events.title: Union of the Crowns
events.description: James VI of Scotland also becomes James I of England and Ireland, uniting the crowns of the three kingdoms under a single monarch for the first time.
events.significance: This event marked the beginning of a personal union between Scotland, England, and Ireland, which eventually led to the formation of the United Kingdom.

events.title: Robert Koch announces discovery of the tuberculosis bacillus
events.description: Robert Koch presents his discovery of Mycobacterium tuberculosis, the bacterium that causes tuberculosis.
events.significance: This discovery was crucial in understanding and combating tuberculosis, a devastating disease at the time.

events.title: Tupolev Tu-144 crashes at the Paris Air Show
events.description: The Soviet supersonic airliner crashes while attempting a demonstration flight, leading to the death of six people.
events.significance: The crash highlighted the risks associated with supersonic passenger aircraft development and impacted the Soviet aviation program.

events.title: Exxon Valdez oil spill
events.description: The oil tanker Exxon Valdez runs aground in Prince William Sound, Alaska, spilling millions of gallons of crude oil into the environment.
events.significance: One of the worst oil spills in U.S. history, it led to major changes in environmental policy and oil transportation regulations.
